DataElement.preferredName: Needle Biopsy Prostate Specimen Total Core Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The total number of cores examined in prostate needle biopsy specimen.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Needle Biopsy Prostate Gland Surgical Pathology Specimen Total Number
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Removal and examination of tissue obtained through a transdermal needle inserted into the specific region, organ, or tissue being analyzed.:The walnut shaped accessory sex gland of the male reproductive system.  It is located in the pelvis just below the bladder, surrounding the prostatic part of the urethra.  The prostate gland secretes a fluid which is part of the semen.:A field of anatomical pathology in which living tissue is surgically removed for the purpose of diagnosis and treatment.:A sample or part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis._Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.:A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Needle Biopsy Prostate Gland Surgical Pathology Specimen
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Removal and examination of tissue obtained through a transdermal needle inserted into the specific region, organ, or tissue being analyzed.:The walnut shaped accessory sex gland of the male reproductive system.  It is located in the pelvis just below the bladder, surrounding the prostatic part of the urethra.  The prostate gland secretes a fluid which is part of the semen.:A field of anatomical pathology in which living tissue is surgically removed for the purpose of diagnosis and treatment.:A sample or part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Concepts.definition: The removal of a tissue sample using a needle, for microscopic examination.

The walnut shaped accessory sex gland of the male reproductive system. It is located in the pelvis just below the bladder, surrounding the prostatic part of the urethra. The prostate gland secretes a fluid which is part of the semen.
A field of anatomical pathology in which tissue or cells removed from a living organism are macroscopically and microscopically reviewed for the purpose of disease diagnosis.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Property.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.:A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A number with no fractional part.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity.:A number with no fractional part.

Concepts.definition: Determining the number or amount of something.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
